item.title: A woman's handbag has been dumped in the alley in SE10 0LH., 9th June
item.description:
A woman's handbag and personal effects including children's clothing have been dumped in the alley leading from Westcombe Hill to the A102M. The alley is next to the Abbey Hilton workshop, a former church hall.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westcombe Hill, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Bins not collected and overflowing, 9th June
item.description:
There are overflowing bins, probably not collected as they contain the wrong types of refuse. But something needs to be done. There is rotting food in the street and people should not have to keep walking past it. Outside 93 Arngask Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arngask Road, Catford South, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large piecebof equipment has been dumped in Ormiston Road SE10 0LN near Halstow Road school. ool, 9th June
item.description:
Children attending Halstow Road school, walk past the equipment which has been dumped in the street, near a waste bin. The equipment has wheels and could be misused. It needs to be removed, please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halstow Road, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Outside no.12 Lyndhurst Gardens, 9th June
item.description:
Under the grille the space is impacted with soil and detritus. As this is at the bottom of the hill there is a risk of overflowing and flooding into 12 Lyndhurst Gardens.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Lyndhurst Gardens, Belsize Park, London
